description.raw:
This is certainly a prototype, but I think it gets us started. I used the ARIAC PopulationPlugin as a starting point for the functionality of moving objects in and out of the USV field of view.

The basic idea is as follows…

* Landmarks \(buoys, etc.\) are part of the word. These landmarks are sequentially moved into the field of view of the USV. Each time a landmark is moved into the field of view constitutes a single ‘trial’ within the run.
* The plugin subscribes to a ROS topic for identification and localization
* For each trial, only one ROS message is accepted
* Plugin compares the reported identification \(based on the name in the frame\_id field\) to the objects name as specified in the plugin SDF.

    * If the identification is correct, then the score is the 2D distance between the landmark position and the estimated position
    * If the identification is incorrect there is no score
    

Some known issues

* When landmarks are moved there is a transient - they bounce around for a couple seconds. One thought is to make turn off visibility of the landmarks for a set period of time.
* Only setup for a single landmark for each trial. Will likely want to have capability to have multiple landmarks for each.
* Developed against Gazebo 7 - will need to modify for Gazebo 9, but thinking that will be done in [PR 70](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/70/transition-to-gazebo-9/diff)

title: Perception plugin
